page.title: 08PUBLIC HOUSES - INNS
page.content:
THE CROWN (TOOT): Owned by a 6 person consortium, each with their own tasks. Extended recently,the pub is still a 'local' with a reputation for good food. Cellar work starts 8-9a.m. Real Ale is sold,an average of 288 gals and 240 bottles of beer and lager being sold weekly. Soft drinks are popular due to the 'breathalyser'. About 80 lunches are served daily. Once part of the Willoughby estate,it was built c1740.
SEVEN STARS (MARSH): Also once part of the Willoughby estate it is now owned by Ushers Brewery. It is very popular on weekend evenings, particularly in the village cricket season. There is a well-attended 'jazz' evening each week. It also has a reputation for good food, serving bar meals, business lunches and a la carte dinners.
